===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=うちわ}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=うちわ|打ち|tr1=uchi|t1=hitting; batting|pos1=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|打つ}} ''utsu'', “to hit, to bat”|羽|tr2=wa|t2=wing}}. The kanji are an example of [[熟字訓#Japanese|jukujikun]].<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|y=i|うちわ|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|うちわ|hhira=うちは}}

# a [[rigid]] [[hand fan]] that does not [[fold]]
# short for {{m|ja|軍配団扇|tr=gunbai uchiwa}}: a rigid fan used for military signaling
# a {{m|ja|家紋|tr=kamon||family crest}} featuring an ''uchiwa'' design

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|軍配団扇|ぐんばい うちわ}}: a rigid fan used for military signaling
* {{ja-r|団扇%撞%木%鮫|ウチワ% シュ%モク%ザメ}}

=====Related terms=====
* {{ja-r|扇子|せんす}}: a [[folding]] [[fan]]
* {{ja-r|扇風機|せんぷうき}}: a [[rotating]] [[fan]], an [[electric]] fan

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|だん|せん}}
Probably from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=だんせん}} compound {{m|zh|團扇|tr=dhuɑn syen<sup>H</sup>|lit=circle fan}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} traditional {{m|zh|團扇}} and simplified {{m|zh|团扇|tr=tuánshàn}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|だんせん|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|だんせん}}

# a [[rigid]] [[hand fan]] that does not [[fold]]
# short for {{m|ja|軍配団扇|tr=gunbai uchiwa}}: a rigid fan used for military signaling
